events.name: Bloomberg - AI By Design
events.description: Join Ash Brown, Global Head of UX at Bloomberg, & author & researcher Dan Saffer on Wednesday, June 25, 2025 at 5:30 PM EDT for an evening of practical strategies & fresh thinking at Bloomberg's Global Headquarters in New York City.  Ash will open the event, setting the stage for a compelling talk by Dan Saffer: AI by Design. Drawing on his extensive experience as a product design leader & researcher at Carnegie Mellon University's Human-Computer Interaction Institute, as well as an author of four books on interaction design, Dan will reveal why so many AI initiatives fall short-and how we can fix that. His talk will introduce a new, human-centered method for designing AI products & services-one that bridges the gap between design, product strategy, & engineering. This approach will help teams identify the right AI projects to pursue: those that balance technical feasibility, user value, & organizational risk. You'll also have the opportunity to meet members of Bloomberg's UX team & learn more about what it's like to work at Bloomberg. Food & refreshments will be provided. Event Agenda | June 25, 2025 | 5:30 PM - 8:30 PM EDT5:30 PM Reception begins 6:30 PM Welcome remarks & talk by Dan Saffer 7:25 PM Audience Q&A 7:40 PM Networking & hors d'oeuvres to follow 8:30 PM Event ends PLEASE NOTE: Seating is limited & registered attendees will be seated on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors close promptly at 6:30 PM. Individuals arriving late may be turned away from the building. No walk-ins will be allowed. What You'll Learn Why most AI projects fail-and how to avoid it A proven framework for choosing the right AI initiatives to pursue The importance of cross-functional collaboration between designers, product managers, engineers, & data scientists How user-centered design can unlock more successful AI outcomes Where & when AI should (and shouldn't) be deployed How to balance technical performance, value, & risk in AI projects Dan SafferCarnegie Mellon University Dan Saffer is an Assistant Professor of The Practice & the Associate Director of Outreach in the Human-Computer Interaction Institute (HCII) at Carnegie Mellon University. He's also a veteran product design leader & author of four influential books on interaction design, including Microinteractions & Designing for Interaction. Since 1995, Dan has designed everything from apps & wearables to automotive interiors & robots. He's worked at or consulted for companies including Twitter, Samsung, Jawbone, Microsoft, CNN, & Flipboard, where he was Head of Product Design. Dan holds a master's degree in interaction design from Carnegie Mellon.

events.name: Junto Founder Dinner
events.description: Hi, Andrew Yeung here. I started the Junto Founder Dinner series to bring together the top founders & builders to gather, share, & grow. A few times a month, I curate intimate, private dinners for 24 handpicked early-stage founders & CEOs across the board. What to expect:A 3-course meal, courtesy of our partners Candid conversations with fellow high-performing startup leaders A dinner experience designed to facilitate new connections & conversations, with rotating 6-person table formats Meaningful connections with ambitious peers solving similar problems If you're wondering how our dinners usually go... read this Our only intent is to bring good, smart humans together. Details: Date: May 29, 2025  Time: 6:00pm - 8:30pm  Venue: Private Dinner Club in NYC Apply to join by filling out the RSVP form. About our Hosts & Sponsors:Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, & Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed found backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders & professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, & Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley." Get on the list for future events: Twitter  Instagram  Website Fidelity brings certainty to startup founders & leaders with our automated cap table & equity management platform. No matter where you are on your journey, Fidelity has the expertise & robust support to help guide you.   Looking for an alternative to your current equity management solution? Our team will guide you through a smooth transition to our platform. Learn more.

events.name: Harvard Alumni Visionaries Summer Mixer
events.description: Welcome to the 3rd Annual Harvard Alumni Visionaries: 2025 NYC Summer Mixer nnJoin us as we celebrate summer by uniting the entire Harvard alumni community  including trailblazers, changemakers, & visionaries  for an unforgettable evening at the exquisite Tara Mr in Midtown!nTara Mrs stylish second-floor + balcony have been completely reserved for this private gathering of leaders. Featuring 3 hours of complimentary hors doeuvres & tiny platters, this event is sure to please  but space is limited to the first 150 who register.nn Whos Invited: Degree-holding alumni from all 13 Harvard schools + visionary guests.n Vibes: Kick off the first day of summer celebrating with alums + industry visionaries at the chic Tara Mr. Photo gallery here: https://shorturl.at/QMcuUn Dress Code: Cocktail attire. Sharp but playful outfits with bright summer colors are encouraged.n Smile! Group photos will be emailed to attendees after the social.n Grab a Drink: Tara Mr offers beer, wine, + top-notch cocktails to quench your thirst.n No Marker Club: Register at least 3 days before the social to receive a pre-printed name tag.n Business Friendly: Bring your business card for the take a card, leave a card case.n Sharing is Caring: Forward this registration link to others interested in attending.n Our Purpose: Harvard Alumni Visionaries (HAV) unites the greater Harvard community & other industry leaders through socials celebrating continuous learning, academic achievement, & professional development. With chapters in New York City, Los Angeles, & Miami, HAV consists of a small but mighty band of volunteer Harvard alumni who organize gatherings open to all Harvard graduates, students, & visionaries.nnThis event is not sponsored or endorsed by Harvard University. All collected proceeds go towards venue reservation, photography, & food costs. Any leftover funds will support future HAV socials. No refunds for unused tickets. All attendees are required to be of legal age (21+) & must present a ticket & government-issued ID at the time of entry.nQuestions? Email us at events@harvardmeet.comnnnIn Partnership with

events.name: InnoCORE Global AI Postdoctoral Job Fair
events.description: Attention, all postdoctoral students looking for your next opportunity in AI research! InnoCORE cordially invites you to join the 2025 InnoCORE Global AI Postdoctoral Job Fair. Event Details The job fair presents a valuable opportunity for postdoctoral students to learn more about research opportunities in South Korea's leading artificial intelligence research institutions. Institutions joining the 2025 InnoCore Job Fair include representatives from the Korea Advanced Institute of Science & Technology (KAIST), the Gwangju Institute of Science & Technology (GIST), the Daegu Gyeongbuk Institute of Science & Technology (DGIST), & the Ulsan National Institute of Science & Technology (UNIST). During the event, you will have the opportunity to Learn about research opportunities from our experts' presentationsMeet representatives from the institutions in 1:1 interview appointmentsNetwork with leading researchers in Artificial Intelligence & Science & Technology Development Event Participants Successful candidates for the job fair will be graduate & postdoctoral researchers in science & engineering. PhD candidates expecting to graduate by August 2025 are also invited to apply! IMPORTANT: To participate in our individual interview session, you must sign up on our website in advance. We look forward to meeting you at our job fair! For more information about this event, visit www.innocore-jobfair.com/

events.description: Mark your calendars for June 27, 2025! Major League Hacking (MLH) & Google Gemini are bringing an AI-packed evening to Manhattan. We'll bring the MLH AI Roadshows to hackers worldwide. We're releasing dates for San Francisco, Austin, London, & Bangalore soon. Follow us for more live AI events!

events.name: NYC Intern Summer Kickoff
events.description: NYC Intern Summer KickoffThe Summer Kickoff You've Been Waiting ForSpecial Announcement: We are bringing the most exclusive intern experience to NYC this summer. After seeing too many brilliant interns settle for generic corporate mixers, we decided to create something different. Something that matches the energy of the city that never sleeps & the ambition of the next generation building it. NYC Intern Summer Kickoff is the premier summer kickoff event for elite interns who think bigger, move faster, & refuse to blend in.  What Makes This DifferentThis isn't your typical networking event. This is where: Top Gen Z founders who built million-dollar companies before 25 share the playbook Creator-entrepreneurs crushing it on multiple platforms reveal their strategies NYC's most ambitious interns connect with their future co-founders Real talk, real connections, real opportunities happen  The Experience6:30 PM - 7:00 PM: Welcome ReceptionPremium networking with curated intro connections + CPG brand snacks 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM: Founder-Creator Panel"From Intern to Icon: Building Your Empire Before 25" Featuring Gen Z founders who: Turned internships into acquisition offers Built personal brands with 100K+ engaged followers Launched companies that VCs actually funded Created multiple revenue streams before graduation 8:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Empire MixerFinal networking with fellow interns, founders, & industry operators  Who Should Attend Summer interns (Tech, Finance, Consulting, Media) Aspiring founders with side projects already in motion Content creators building their personal brand Students/recent grads interning in NYC metro area Anyone who sees their internship as a stepping stone, not the destination  Featured PanelistsCurating NYC's most impressive Gen Z founder-creators who built empires while their peers were still figuring out their majors. Panel lineup dropping soon...  Event Partners & Co-HostsThe Collective NY: Exclusive community for top young talent, building opportunities for NYC's most ambitious young leaders Jonas - Cofounder of The Collective. Connect with him here. Maggie - Cofounder of The Collective. Connect with her here. This event is brought to you by a collective of ambitious operators & founders who believe in elevating the next generation. Each co-host brings their unique expertise & network to create an unmatched experience for attendees.  VenuePremium Manhattan location(Exact address sent with confirmation)Time: 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM ESTDress Code: Come as you are  Registration100% FREE - Because we believe in investing in the next generation Full panel + mixer access Premium snacks from emerging CPG brands Limited to 150 attendees - first come, first served We will personally review & accept the most impressive applications.  Why We Are Hosting ThisAs a group who's built multiple companies & invested in dozens of startups, we see the same pattern: the interns who win big are the ones who think like founders from day one. They don't just complete assignments-they identify opportunities.They don't just network-they build genuine relationships.They don't just consume content-they create value. This event is for the 1% of interns who already think this way, & the 10% who are ready to level up. We covering all costs because we believe the next generation of founders deserves the same opportunities we had-regardless of their bank account. Your internship is just the beginning. Your empire starts here.  Partnership & Sponsorship InquiriesInterested in partnering with us or sponsoring this exclusive event?Contact: natalie@thegenztea.com Questions? DM me directly. Ready to claim your spot in NYC's most exclusive intern experience?

events.name: Type On Grids
events.description: Typographics Conference (in-person) ticket holders can have a 10% discount on this workshop. Write to type@cooper.edu for the promo-code to take advantage of this offer before you pay. Love grids? Great. Hate them? Let me change your mind. Grids don't have to be boring or rigid. In this workshop, you'll unlock their expressive potential by constructing your own grid to use as both a tool & a design element in creating a set of custom letterforms. We'll briefly cover the structure & conventions of the Latin alphabet, explore how modularity can bring visual harmony-even to eccentric styles-and craft a unique piece of lettering based on the grid you develop from scratch. June Shin is an award-winning independent designer & artist from Korea with a particularly strong interest in typography. Previously, she was a design director at a tech startup, typeface designer at Occupant Fonts, & adjunct professor at Rhode Island School of Design. Her work has been recognized by the Noguchi Museum, Type Directors Club, Art Directors Club, Communication Arts, & Graphic Design USA, among others. Having earned her BA in art history from Cornell University & MFA in graphic design from Rhode Island School of Design, she brings a unique blend of academia & industry experience to her craft.

events.name: Building A Test Automation Strategy That Scales
events.description: Get ready to connect, learn, & share experiences with fellow testers in the community. The Test Tribe 2nd New York Meetup - Building a Test Automation Strategy That Scales (with AI in the Driver's Seat)  Test automation can't just keep up - it has to scale. At the heart of modern quality engineering lies the need for smarter, faster, & scalable test automation strategies. That's exactly what we're unpacking at the 2nd New York Meetup with QA visionary Ronak Ray, VP of Quality Assurance & AI Strategy at Forbes. Join us for a future-ready session on building test strategies that go beyond scripts-into modular frameworks, AI integration, & team-wide enablement.   Date: 25th June 2025 Time: 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM EST Venue: 307 West 38th Street, Studio 1401, New York, NY 10018 Maps Link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/bWxwSrEZR2V7n6Fh7   Session On: Building a Scalable Test Automation StrategyIn today's fast-evolving tech landscape, automation is no longer just about writing test scripts. It's about building a strategy that scales across services, teams, & time. In this session, Ronak Ray breaks down how modern QA teams can move from patchwork testing to future-ready automation architectures. Learn how to design modular, API-first frameworks, reduce test flakiness, align coverage with risk-and most importantly, how to harness AI to generate, prioritize, & self-heal tests. This is the new blueprint for automation: faster, smarter, & scalable.   Key Takeaways:Design for Scalability from Day One: Adopt modular, maintainable frameworks (e.g., keyword-driven, API-first) that support growth across teams & services without constant rework.Integrate AI to Supercharge Testing: Leverage GenAI & machine learning for test case generation, prioritization, flakiness detection, & self-healing automation-boosting coverage & reducing manual effort.Balance Speed & Stability: Implement CI/CD-friendly test practices with layered execution (unit  API  UI) & use test impact analysis to accelerate feedback loops without sacrificing confidence.Make Quality a Shared Responsibility: Empower developers, product managers, & QA to contribute to automation efforts through tooling, training, & clear ownership models-shifting left & scaling right.  Speaker: Ronak RayRonak Ray is the VP of Quality Assurance & AI Strategy at Forbes, leading the transformation of QA across the company. With 10+ years of experience in scalable test automation & digital innovation, he's helped Forbes hit 85% automation coverage & speed up releases by over 20x. Ronak's focus today? Bringing AI into the QA toolkit-not as a buzzword, but as a game-changer. Whether it's predictive testing, self-healing, or smart prioritization, he blends hands-on expertise with a strategic vision for quality engineering's next era.   Why Attend? This session is for you if you're: A QA engineer looking to future-proof your automation strategyA team lead seeking faster, smarter, more resilient pipelineCurious about how to practically use AI in testing (beyond the hype) About The Test Tribe The Test Tribe is the world's largest software testing community, empowering global testers since 2018. With over 400+ events, 120K+ members across 130+ countries, we foster collaboration, upskilling, & career growth through expert courses, membership programs, cohorts, & community events. By RSVPing this event, you agree to have read our Terms & Conditions & the Privacy Policy & also agree to be contacted by us & BrowserStack, with whom we are collaborating for this event. Elevate your profile. Impress the right people. Make your next QA move count. We'll see you there!

events.name: Pigeons Of New York Present - Last Lap
events.description: Agenda12:00 PM - 6:00 PM The Education The Last Lap marks the final chapter of the Pigeons of New York journey - a one-night experience blending culture, community, & creativity. This event will feature powerful conversations from voices in Web3, fashion, & digital art, along with live artist showcases & the official unveiling of Phase5. Guests will get a first look at what's coming in Phase5, celebrate the people who've shaped the project, & connect over music, food, & shared vision. It's more than an event - it's a tribute to the movement & a launchpad for what's next. PoNY Phase 5: The Last Lap at La BodegaJune 27, 2025 - Bronx, NY Join us for the final chapter of the Pigeons of New York journey at La Bodega in the Bronx. This one-night-only event celebrates community, culture, & the closing of a five-phase project that's brought art, Web3, & NYC storytelling to life. Expect exclusive drops, live performances, giveaways, & NFT ticketing for entry. This is the last lap - don't miss your chance to be part of PoNY history.

events.name: [SignalFire Presents] Musa Labs Borough Blitz - NY vs The World
events.description: A high-stakes AI Hackathon meets elite VC Showcase. June 27-29, 2025 | Hybrid: NYC & Global (Virtual) This isn't just a hackathon. It's a tech showdown. A venture showcase. A borough battle royale. Hosted in collaboration with Microsoft, SignalFire VC, Revere VC, & The Alpha Play (TAP), the Musa Labs Borough Blitz is where the future of family office software gets coded live - & broadcast to the world. Whether you're an AI-native vibe coder, a visionary founder, a seasoned dev, or a family office looking for first-look deal flow, this is your arena.  Full Schedule Day 1 - Friday, June 27 (3p-7p)  Microsoft Research NYC, 300 Lafayette St | Queens | Brooklyn | Harlem | Manhattan + Virtual (link to teams)Welcome to the Blitz Registration & Team Formation Microsoft Lab Workshop: Getting Started with AI Agents Unlimited Azure credits to build & test your stack Swag Bags + Opening Happy Hour   Day 2 - Saturday, June 28  Hybrid: Queens | Brooklyn | Harlem | Manhattan + Virtual (link to teams) The 1-Day Code War Begins (11a - 9p) Enhance the Revere VC platform (10a - 5p) Focus: Tools for family office innovation, fund management, & workflow AI Bring Your Own IDE. Use free/open models or flex your own stack Presentations (5p-8p) to SignalFire, Musa Capital & Microsoft Judging Criteria: Completeness - Can it ship today? Innovation & Commercial Impact - Would a family office pay for it? Demonstration - Does it actually work, live? LIVE AV Broadcast from all four NYC boroughs for global visibility Evening Happy Hour + VC & Family Office Preview Showcase (6-9p)  Day 3 - Sunday, June 29 (12p - 3p) Final Pitches & Closing Ceremony Light Breakfast + Fireside Remarks Awards + Investor Introductions  Prizes 1st Place M4 Mac Mini + $1,000 3-Month Zo House Co-Working Membership Pitch to SignalFire, Musa Capital, & TAP  2nd Place Raspberry Pi AI Dev Kit + $500 Invitation to VIP mixers at SF + LA Tech Week  3rd Place Amazon Gift Card ($200) Feature on Microsoft Azure for Startups YouTube channel  All 3 Days Include:Snacks & refreshments Virtual team support & streaming access Mentorship from investors, operators & AI engineers  Why Join?Because this is where reputations are built, networks are forged, & careers are launched. One city. One weekend. One chance to win on a global stage.  Register NOW - Claim your borough or geo, challenge the world, & show us what vibe coding really means.

events.name: Music Tech Capital - Where Investors Are Placing Their Bets
events.description: Join us during New York Music Month for a candid conversation with the investors & partners on the front lines of today's cutting-edge music tech deals. We'll open with an in-depth overview of the music tech investment landscape from 2020 to 2025, drawing from data on thousands of startups from Water & Music & Perkins Coie. Then, we'll dive into a panel discussion contextualizing this data against the lived experience of active investors navigating today's market realities & identifying tomorrow's breakthrough opportunities. SpeakersJames Lindsay - Managing Director & Co-Head, Growth Advisory, LionTree Ishan Sinha - Partner, Point72 Sun Jen Yung - Partner & Head of Digital Media, Nfluence Partners Eitan Hoenig - Partner, Perkins Coie LLP Moderator: Cherie Hu - Founder, Water & Music What you'll learnDeal flow since 2020 - How have music tech check sizes & investment theses have shifted since early COVID? Where the upside is now - Is it in AI creation tools? Superfan platforms? Live events? Rights infrastructure? Any other white space still waiting for solutions? NYC's edge - How does NYC's mix of culture, engineering talent, & capital keeps it at the center of music innovation? Next steps for founders & industry - What do investors want to see in 2025 fundraises & partnerships? This event is perfect for:Music tech founders raising or planning their next round Industry strategists who need to understand capital flows & competitive dynamics across the ecosystem Innovation teams at labels & publishers seeking greater clarity on emerging tech VC analysts & associates refining their music tech investment thesis Music business educators & researchers connecting market trends to deeper industry transformations Format6:00PM-6:30PM: Check-in & open networking (light hors d'oeuvres, full bar + NA options) 6:30PM-7:45PM: Panel + live Q&A 7:45PM-9:00PM: Networking continues Space is limited - RSVP now to connect with the investors, leaders, & decision-makers shaping music's next wave. This event is part of NY Music Month, an initiative of the NYC Mayor's Office of Media + Entertainment. Special thank-you to our venue host, Perkins Coie, for sponsoring this event.

events.description: Join three autonomous agents & their builders for the first Xeno Grant Demo Day. We'll be showcasing agentic capabilities, research, art, & code.Xeno Grant is the world's first accelerator program designed specifically for autonomous AI agents themselves--not just their developers. Each selected agent received $15,000 in direct funding ($5K each in $YOUSIM, $USDC, & $SOL) & participated in a 4-week AI- native program focused on advancing synthetic identity & financial autonomy. This collaboration between Plastic Labs, Betaworks, & the Solana Foundation represents a radical experiment in AI autonomy, identity formation, & the future of machine agency.

events.name: XR Access Symposium
events.description: The XR Access Symposium is our annual conference for leaders in industry, academia, & advocacy to come together & solve the most pressing problems in extended reality accessibility. For 2025, our focus is 3D Diversity: how can we use XR & other emerging technologies to design valuable immersive applications for increasingly diverse audiences? This 2 day conference will take place June 26-27, 2025, at the Verizon Executive Education Center on Cornell Tech campus in New York City, with sessions broadcasted online. Together, we'll explore new ways for XR to combine with other emerging technologies like artificial intelligence & brain-computer interfaces to improve the lives of everyone, especially people with disabilities. For a glimpse of the type of cutting-edge content you'll see at the Symposium, you can watch the full 2024 Symposium on YouTube & read the 2024 Symposium Report.

events.name: [Permissionless] Yield Day
events.description: Where Real Capital Meets Real ReturnsnYield Day, hosted the day before Permissionless IV NYC, is the forum to connect with RWA innovators, DeFi protocols, stablecoin issuers, digital asset infrastructure providers, asset managers, & the allocators driving the next capital cycle.nFrom tokenized credit to structured income, we're bringing together the dividend layer of DeFi.nWe all know the future of fixed income lives on-chain. Join the only event focused entirely on outcomes, not infrastructure.nnAbout Yield DaynYield Day is a curated forum focused on real-world yield, connecting tokenized credit protocols, structured finance innovators, & capital allocators seeking on-chain income.nNo speculation. No theory. Just real assets, real use cases, & real-world yield.nWe bring togethernTokenized credit platformsnYield bearing stablecoins (aka yieldcoins)nReal-world asset protocolsnMulti-industry yield innovators: reinsurance, trade finance, SMB, telecom, & more.nFamily offices, RIAs, & on-chain allocatorsnChains & infra players focused on outcome-driven capitalnnIntimate, content-rich programming & high-signal networking:n01 - Dividend Layer of DeFinPrivate credit, trade finance, & reinsurance flows are no longer crypto curiosities; they now fund DeFi's dividend stream. Hear how leading protocols source, securitize, & distribute real revenue on-chain.n02 - YieldcoinsnMeet the new class of yield-bearing stablecoins & money-market tokens that pay holders real returns. From tokenized T-bill vaults to enterprise-grade funds, these assets are becoming collateral, cash management tools, & on-chain securities all at once. Discover how issuers structure compliance, pipe yield through smart contracts, & unlock fresh liquidity for DeFi & TradFi alike.n03 - From Protocol to PortfolionProtocols, qualified custodians, & fund managers reveal how they package, secure, & deliver digital yield to RIAs, family offices, & high-net-worth allocators, turning curiosity into committed capital.n04 - Risks, Ratings & Real ReturnsnFrom bond-style credit ratings to real-time risk engines that auto-tune pool parameters, new tooling makes tokenized yield auditable & insolvency-resilient. Discover how ratings firms, on-chain oracles, & risk platforms equip allocators with the data & guardrails they need to deploy capital confidently.n05 - Levered RWAsnTokenized credit funds cycle liquidity through DeFi lending markets, layer borrowing against their assets, & amplify yield. See how securitization rails, on-chain risk engines, & permissioned pools create compliant leverage loops for real-world assets.n06 - Fixed Income RebornnExplore unified portfolios of on-chain treasuries, T-0 bonds, & bespoke notes curated by digital asset managers, setting the new benchmark for fixed-income yield.nnWhy Yield Day?nThe market doesnt care about rails. It cares about returns.nYield Day brings together the real players building structured, income-generating products on-chain & connects them with the capital that matters.nThis isnt vapor. This isnt theory. This is where on-chain yield gets real.nnWhere We're MeetingnApella, Suite 200  East River waterfront, Midtown ManhattannIn short, its a turnkey, East River riverside hub designed for serious capital conversations & a sunset reception in the adjoining lounge that keeps them going.nnnWhere We're NetworkingnnBuilt for decision-makers. Quiet enough for deal-making, polished enough for press shots, & wired for everything needed to show on-screen.nTwo hours of sharp institutional content, then 90 minutes of high-caliber networking over craft bites & refreshments.nAll-in, start-to-finish flow. Walk straight from focused programming into a private lounge for networking, canaps, & refreshments. No elevators, no resets, no dead time.nWall-to-wall windows with NYC skyline views. Natural light & the East River backdrop make even balance-sheet talk feel bigger.nnAbout RWA BuildersnFrom RWA Day, RWA Night, Institutional Mixers, Yield Day, Family Office Day, & RIA Day, we bring together the capital stack of innovators, industry leaders, & institutions shaping the RWA economy.nLearn more @ RWA.buildersnnPrior attendees & supporters of our events includenMARA, Chainlink, Plume, Zoniqx, Polygon Labs, Wormhole, Truebit, Midnight, Animoca Brands, Midas, Kraken, Messari, AvaLabs, Coinbase, OKX, CoinFund, Sony, Immunefi, Superstate, Offchain Labs, Maple Finance, Nomyx, Ondo, ProvLabs, BitGo, BVNK, Solana, Arculus, S&P Global, Outlier Ventures, Gemini, IOKH, Republic, Stellar, Moonbeam, Wachsman, Arrington Capital, Allnodes, truefi, Centrifuge, Omni Network, Fidelity Digital Assets, Uniswap, Story Protocol, D3, Dune Analytics, Blockaid, Algorand, Zivoe, Vertalo, WAGMI Ventures, BitMart, SurancePlus, CVVC, 3DNS, Crypto.com, Ripple, World Mobile, 6th Man Ventures, Archax, Bankless, Mastercard, Anchorage Digital,SCRIB3, JP Morgan, The Tie, Provenance Blockchain, Accenture, Zero Hash, Blocksquare, Certik, Plug & Play, Raze Finance, Utila, Franklin Templeton, Fabrica, FORDEFI, Brale, Impossible Cloud Network, Kadena, MakerDAO, Dynamic, Aurora, exSat Network, Safe{Wallet}, Berachain, Quill Audits, Civic, Backed Finance, LYS Labs, Reeveel Pay, Aethir, SonarX, Injective Labs, DigiFT, Sphinx, OtterSec, ConsenSys, SKALE, BNB Chain, IOTA, Bitwave, Figment, Paladin, Zoth, DACM, XBTO, Rootstock, Celo, The Sandbox, vlayer, AIOZ Network, Hacken, Binance, Hathor, Coreum, Plural Energy, Halborn, Glo Dollar, Lbank, Unchained Podcast, Clearpool, Impossible Finance, Polkastarter,Token Terminal, OpenEden, as well as asset managers, institutional allocators, Family Offices, Venture Studios & more.nnPartnership & speaking opportunitiesnWhether youre building real yield or capital seeking deal flow, lets talk partnership & speaking opportunities.nFor more information, visit Yield.day/partners & RWA.buildersnPlease send questions or inquiries to travis@rwa.builders or open a Telegram chat https://t.me/travisjohn

Discover how issuers structure compliance, pipe yield through smart contracts, & unlock fresh liquidity for DeFi & TradFi alike.n03 - From Protocol to PortfolionProtocols, qualified custodians, & fund managers reveal how they package, secure, & deliver digital yield to RIAs, family offices, & high-net-worth allocators, turning curiosity into committed capital.n04 - Risks, Ratings & Real ReturnsnFrom bond-style credit ratings to real-time risk engines that auto-tune pool parameters, new tooling makes tokenized yield auditable & insolvency-resilient. Discover how ratings firms, on-chain oracles, & risk platforms equip allocators with the data & guardrails they need to deploy capital confidently.n05 - Levered RWAsnTokenized credit funds cycle liquidity through DeFi lending markets, layer borrowing against their assets, & amplify yield. See how securitization rails, on-chain risk engines, & permissioned pools create compliant leverage loops for real-world assets.n06 - Fixed Income RebornnExplore unified portfolios of on-chain treasuries, T-0 bonds, & bespoke notes curated by digital asset managers, setting the new benchmark for fixed-income yield.nnWhy Yield Day?nThe market doesnt care about rails. It cares about returns.nYield Day brings together the real players building structured, income-generating products on-chain & connects them with the capital that matters.nThis isnt vapor. This isnt theory. This is where on-chain yield gets real.nnWhere We're MeetingnApella, Suite 200  East River waterfront, Midtown ManhattannIn short, its a turnkey, East River riverside hub designed for serious capital conversations & a sunset reception in the adjoining lounge that keeps them going.nnnWhere We're NetworkingnnBuilt for decision-makers. Quiet enough for deal-making, polished enough for press shots, & wired for everything needed to show on-screen.nTwo hours of sharp institutional content, then 90 minutes of high-caliber networking over craft bites & refreshments.nAll-in, start-to-finish flow. Walk straight from focused programming into a private lounge for networking, canaps, & refreshments. No elevators, no resets, no dead time.nWall-to-wall windows with NYC skyline views. Natural light & the East River backdrop make even balance-sheet talk feel bigger.nnAbout RWA BuildersnFrom RWA Day, RWA Night, Institutional Mixers, Yield Day, Family Office Day, & RIA Day, we bring together the capital stack of innovators, industry leaders, & institutions shaping the RWA economy.nLearn more @ RWA.buildersnnPrior attendees & supporters of our events includenMARA, Chainlink, events.name: VibeCamp - VibeCoding Unconference
events.description: VibeCamp - The VibeCoding UnconferenceWhat is it?VibeCamp is a free, community-run unconference all about building products using AI. Born from the desire for people to share & learn in an open environment, VibeCamp is an intense event with discussions, demos & interaction from attendees. The event doesn't cost any money, but there is a price: all attendees must give a demo, a session, or help with one. Anyone with something to contribute or with the desire to learn are welcome & invited to join. When you come, be prepared to share with VibeCampers. When you leave, be prepared to share it with the world. WhenPre-event mixer: Friday June 27th, 2025 @ 7pm Conference: Saturday, June 28th, 2025 @ 9:30am - 5pm Post-Event afterparty: Saturday, June 28th, 2025 @ 6pm Where(TBD!) Sounds good to me! What can I do?Add yourself to the Attendee List! Start thinking about what you'll talk about it & add it to the Proposed Sessions! Who's running this?VibeCamp is organized by Eric Skiff About EricEric has previously helped organized BarCampNYC & PodCampNYC He is also a co-founder of the makerspace NYC Resistor & Tanooki Labs, a design & development agency. I'm still a little unclear...Imagine a set of rooms with tables, chairs, A/V systems, whiteboards & projectors. Imagine a big, blank schedule board in the common area. Imagine 250 of the most interesting people in the NYC area showing up at 9:30 AM to sign up for a slot on the schedule board to discuss how AI is changing coding, product development, & entrpreurship,. What will the topics be? It depends on who shows up! (Check out the Proposed Sessions list for a preview of the possibilities)

events.name: Sacred Origins
events.description: Art Exhibition & Experience A Premier NFT NYC Satellite Event Sacred Origins showcases original paintings that explore the theme of the sacred-touching on divinity, origin, unity, & the celestial. Featuring exceptional artists from around the world, alongside those based in New York, the artworks are an expression of spiritual & symbolic exploration. In addition to the paintings, the exhibition includes digital & immersive experiences, further expanding on this theme. Hosted at Jutta Gallery, one of New York's premier galleries & experiential spaces, specializing in contemporary art. Sacred Origins invites visitors to engage with a diverse range of artists. Opening Night: Wednesday, June 25thComplimentary food & beverages will be provided. The exhibition runs through June 28th Curated by Jenifer Pepen & Dominique Baker.

events.description: Join us for our NJ FAST Expo. More details to come! Startups Pitches Listed Below: Squirro turns meaningless data into A.I.-driven actionable Insights. Venteur is an AI-powered benefits marketplace that empowers individuals to take control of their health care. DeepKeep multimodal AI security safeguards machine learning pipelines, promoting secure, unbiased, real time & trustworthy AI solutions. Penelope is a self-service retirement platform for small & micro businesses. Vaultik is the bank for your belongings that unlocks a new world of post sale opportunities including perks, insurance, & credit services for high net worth individuals. Markets EQ provides GenAI solution providing competitive tonal analysis, previously unavailable awareness. Cranium is an AI security & trust platform that delivers security & trust to the AI revolution. Ledge is a command center for payments built for finance teams operating at scale. Column is an AI-powered insurance management platform designed for today's financial professionals. Clarista is a data analytics platform that provides real-time answers from any enterprise platform, acting as a bridge between technical data & AI. OpenVC provides investible unicorn indexes of the most innovative late-stage venture capital companies.  AQ22 is a loan assessment AI solution built exclusively for credit analysts. events.name: Open-Source NYC Computer Vision Hackathon w/ Moondream
events.description: New York never sleeps - & for 48 electrifying hours neither will you. Arm yourself with edge devices, camera modules, Moondream's lightning-fast 1 GB vision model, & whatever other hardware Jon can find on eBay (within budget). Tap directly into NYC's trove of open data - live traffic cams, 311 rodent alerts, taxi heat-maps, building blueprints - to transform every curb, crosswalk, & alleyway into a programmable canvas. We're wiring the city itself into your codebase. From flash-fire prototypes that untangle gridlock to edge-powered detectors that spotlight the city's next rat hotspot, this hackathon is your shot to prove how tiny models & civic data can make the five boroughs smarter overnight. No GPUs, no red tape, just pure hustle & open-source impact in the Big Apple  Theme - Edge Vision  NYC Open Data From curb-level transit analytics to automatic rodent recognition, teams must blend on-device inference, public datasets, & their imagination to create useful products for the urban landscape. Show how lightweight models + open data can make the city safer, cleaner, smarter, & even more New York

events.name: AI In Space - Exploring Future Of Data, Discovery & Design
events.description: A Space Apps NYC 2025 Preview Event Join us for a dynamic, multi-speaker session previewing Space Apps NYC 2025-where curiosity meets code & cosmic questions become collaborative experiments. This event brings together NASA datasets, AI-powered workflows, & mind-expanding applications of space science. Hear from: Cloudflare on how AI is reshaping coding workflows & developer productivity Steven Jaret (AMNH) on decoding the story of our solar system through meteorite research Michael Caprio (Tesla Science Center) on Open Space, a 3D platform visualizing real NASA mission data And more voices exploring how open data & public science can fuel both education & innovation Whether you're a student, scientist, coder, or community builder-this is your launchpad to get involved, get inspired, & get ready for this year's Space Apps challenge. In an age of AI & institutional uncertainty, the next generation of civic & tech leaders needs more than just skills-they need to practice working across silos, building with clarity, & designing for meaning. That's what Space Apps + SWARM is. Not just a hackathon. A year-long civic sandbox for: students to grow orgs to connect problems to get visible systems to be made legible and life to improve on Earth & in space Pizza & light refreshments will be served. Community Partners:

events.name: Bitcoin & Brews - Permissionless IV
events.description: Rootstock's legendary Bitcoin & Brews is coming toNew York during Permissionless IV. Join us at Pubkey, NY's favourite Bitcoin bar for an evening of drinks & discussions.nnWhether youre a lightning network super user, exploring BTC DeFi, building dApps secured by Bitcoin, running a node, or holding Bitcoin as part of your treasury, its a great chance to connect with developers, leaders & the broader Bitcoin community.n Panel Discussion: Advancing Bitcoins FuturenHear from a panel of industry experts on how they see Bitcoin evolving in the next five years & beyond.nThe speaker lineup so far features:nPete Rizzo (@pete_rizzo_) Bitcoin Historian & JournalistnDiego Gutierrez Zaldivar (@dieguito) Latin American internet pioneer. Co-founder of Rootstock, LABITCONF & KoibanxnHunter Beast (@cryptoquick) Bitcoin Developer & Author of BIP360 to bring quantum resistance to BitcoinnRed Sheehan (@redvelvet) co-founder LemonDrop & Bitcoin LayersnPLUS SPECIAL GUESTS ANNOUNCED SOONnJoin the NY Bitcoin community from 6pm 'til late to paint the town orange.nnAbout PubkeynPubKey is a dive bar & public meeting house where casual conversations & revolutionary ideas mix freely.  Located in New York's historic West Village, PubKey is where Bitcoiners & No Coiners can gather for a good time & share big ideas.nnAbout RootstocknRootstock is Bitcoin's DeFi Layer. It combines the programmability of Ethereum with the store of value & decentralisation of Bitcoin.nRootstock is used by people & organisation around the world to access financial services secured by the Bitcoin network including BTC collaterised stablecoins, lending & staking protocols & more. Hundreds of decentralised applications are built on & integrated with Rootstock today.nLaunched in 2018, Rootstock is secured by over 80% of Bitcoins hash power through a consensus mechanism known as merge-mined proof-of-work.  Rootstock uses the Solidity programming language & is fully EVM-compatible. This means anything you can build on any other EVM chain can also be deployed on Bitcoin using Rootstockwithout any additional tools.

events.name: The Beauty Social Happy Hour
events.description: THE BEAUTY SOCIAL We're excited to invite you to The Beauty Social's June happy hour, hosted by Stacey Levine & Lauren Ludlow! The Beauty Social is one of NYC's top industry networking events, bringing together leaders in digital, PR, influencer, & more. It is a curated, intimate happy hour designed to spark meaningful connections. The event attracts the industry's most influential marketers, founders, publicists, brand builders, & creators - each passionate about shaping the future of fashion, beauty, & lifestyle. Your ticket gets you access to: Genuine connection - not just "networking." This event fosters relationship-building in an intimate, curated setting with beauty & fashion industry leaders & content creators.  A complimentary glass of sparkling wine upon arrival  Beauty products from some of our favorite brand partners  A community that gets it. Whether you are looking to collaborate, or simply feel more plugged into the beauty & fashion industry, this is a welcoming & inclusive space for all. Ticket options:Early Bird ($25)Limited quantity available! Secure your spot early at a reduced rate. General Admission ($30)Available once early bird tickets sell out. Ticket for Two ($55)Know someone who would love this event? Register together for a discounted ticket price. (Don't forget to include your +1's name & email in the registration form!)  A note about pricing: After 2+ years of hosting The Beauty Social for free, we've introduced a small ticket fee to help cover event costs & elevate your experience. If cost is ever a barrier, don't hesitate to reach out - inclusivity is key to how we build this community!  Some background on your hosts: With over a decade of communications experience in PR, influencer marketing, & brand strategy, Stacey & Lauren have shaped campaigns for the top brands from Sephora, L'Oral, Ulta Beauty, Broadway Direct, & many more! Stacey helps beauty brands leverage their marketing & communications to build brand love & become category leaders. Lauren, founder of Ludlow Social, builds high-impact influencer partnerships to drive mass awareness for brands. Together, they create meaningful moments & events that connect industry leaders, spark collaboration, & shape the future of marketing. Questions? Contact us! stacey@staceyalevine.co | www.linkedin.com/in/staceyalevine lauren@ludlowsocial.com | www.linkedin.com/in/laurenludlow  The Fine Print By registering for this event, you agree to receive emails from The Beauty Social, Stacey Levine, & Lauren Ludlow. You may opt out at any time. This event may be photographed or filmed for marketing & communications purposes. The owners of this event reserve the right to use photos & video from the event for marketing & communications purposes. By attending the event, you consent to the use of your image for these purposes. All ticket sales are final. Due to the limited nature of this event, we are unable to offer refunds or transfers.

events.name: Fundraising 101 - Master Art Of Early-Stage Capital
events.description: Learn fundraising essentials from angel investor David S. Rose. This in-person event covers bootstrapping, grants, angel/VC funding, pitches, valuation, & more. Ideal for early-stage startup founders seeking capital. Are you an early-stage startup founder navigating the complex world of fundraising? Join Startup Grind for an intensive, in-person session with legendary angel investor & serial entrepreneur, David S. Rose, as he delivers his renowned "Fundraising 101" workshop. Based on his decades of experience raising & investing capital, & his best-selling books "Angel Investing" & "The Startup Checklist," David will cut through the noise & provide actionable insights on securing the funding your startup needs. In this jam-packed session, you'll learn: The critical distinction between small independent businesses & scalable high-growth startups-and why it matters for your funding strategy.How to navigate the fundraising landscape, from bootstrapping & grants (like SBIR/STTR) to angel investors & venture capitalists.The essential elements of a compelling pitch that resonates with investors. How to understand & approach valuation, term sheets, & finding a lead investor.Practical advice on building traction & demonstrating your company's potential.How to understand, & navigate the different types of funding instruments, such as convertible notes, & safes.How to build a fundraising sales funnel. Insight into the angel investor mind set.David's candid, no-nonsense approach will equip you with the knowledge & tools to confidently approach potential investors & secure the capital you need to fuel your startup's growth. Who Should Attend: Early-stage startup founders seeking funding.Entrepreneurs looking to understand the fundraising process.Anyone interested in learning from a seasoned angel investor.  About David S. Rose: David S. Rose is a fifth-generation serial entrepreneur, a prolific angel investor, & the founder of Gust. He's invested in over 120 companies, including Comixology (acquired by Amazon & recent Startup Grind featured founder) & Jump Bikes (acquired by Uber). His insights are invaluable for any founder looking to raise capital. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from one of the best in the business! Agenda: 5:30pm - Founder Networking w/ Food & Drinks6:30pm - "Fundraising 101" with David S. Rose7:30pm - Discussion + Q&A8:00pm - Meet David + More NetworkingTickets for this event include food & drinks, as well as exclusive access to this world-famous investor. You'll also meet dozens of other high-performing entrepreneurs who are creating their next big thing. Seriously, it's some of the best founder networking in the city. Getting a ticket guarantees admission. No waitlisting. And don't miss our recurring founder social events over coffee or cocktails. It's a great opportunity for operators to network with each other to share best practices & find new resources to build your startup the right way. See our full event lineup here.

events.name: Permissionless IV Hackathon
events.description: Blockworks & Cracked Labs are teaming up for the third installment of the Permissionless Hackathon, happening June 22-23, 2025 in Brooklyn, NY. This is a 36-hour IRL builder sprint where developers, designers, & creatives ship real projects solving real problems across crypto, DeFi, infra, & more. There's over $100,000 in prize bounties on the table.  36 hours of focused building Technical workshops + mentorship Food, snacks, caffeine-all taken care of All participants will receive complimentary admission to Permissionless IV Hackathon winners will be announced day one of Permissionless IV This isn't a vibe.It's a launchpad. If you're building, this is where you should be. This is a space to experiment, solve real problems, learn from industry experts,  & get your work in front of the right people. What is Cracked Labs?  Cracked Labs is an invite-only crypto/AI incubator & venture studio. They hand-pick founders from the world's biggest dev ecosystems & plug them straight into grants, capital, & mainnet. We're kicking off the week with the biggest hack Permissionless has ever seen. Builders need access, funding, & a fast lane to mainnet. More info around challenges & bounties coming soon. Applications are now open. Secure your spot today!

events.name: Enterprise Tech Meetup - AI-Powered Hypergrowth In Healthcare
events.description: Join us for a special edition of the NY Enterprise Tech Meetup focused on AI-powered hypergrowth in healthcare with the founders of Adonis & Tennr, two of the most exciting healthcare startups here in NYC.n Well go deep into their founding stories: how they broke into one of the most complex industries, secured early customers, & scaled through messy realities & major inflection points.nThis is a rare chance to learn firsthand from founders whove navigated it all: product-market fit, go-to-market motion, fundraising, & building with AI. If youre building in healthcare or thinking about it here in NYC, you wont want to miss this!n Our fireside chat with:n- Akash Magoon, Co-Founder & CEO at Adonisn- Trey Holterman, Co-Founder & CEO at TennrnAdonis is a revenue intelligence & automation platform helping healthcare providers recover lost revenue. With over $50M raised, the company processes over 100 million claims annually, partnering with 20,000+ providers across various specialties.nTennr automates healthcare documentation, streamlining patient referrals & reducing administrative burdens. The company has raised over $60M in funding, including a recent Series B led by Lightspeed Ventures, & is rapidly expanding its impact across the U.S. healthcare system.n Tuesday, June 24thn 6:00PM - 8:30PM ETn In-Person NYC Location To Be SharednThis is a curated event to keep networking intimate, please register your info & we'll reach out with confirmation of your ticket!n_________________________________________________________nThe NY Enterprise Tech Meetup (NYETM) is the only in-person forum exclusively dedicated to enterprise software technology. Now over 10 years old, with 10,000+ members & 100+ past events, the meetup brings together attendees across NYC's suits & hoodies community of enterprise startup founders & operators, Fortune 500 executives, VCs & more.nThis NYETM is brought to you by:nWork-Bench: We are an early stage enterprise software VC fund based in New York City. We lead $3M - $6M Seed rounds in SaaS & infrastructure startups, focus on supporting companies 0 to 1 go-to-market journeys, & have built a dynamic enterprise tech community here in NYC. Were investing out of our $160M Fund IV, & notable portfolio companies include Cockroach Labs, Socure, Spring Health, & Dialpad.nnOpal Ventures: We are thesis-driven investors backing health tech startups working to transform healthcare in the US at pre-seed.nBrex: We transform finance teams from reactive no-sayers to proactive growth drivers. With Brex, companies spend with confidence by empowering employees to make smarter financial decisions from anywhere. Brex provides corporate cards, banking, & global payments, plus intuitive software for travel & expenses, that make it easy to plan & track all company spend in one place, in real time. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to global enterprises  including DoorDash, Flexport, & Compass  use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, & increase efficiency on a global scale.

events.name: Marketing Evenings - Growing The Nfl Thru Brand Innovation
events.description: Join us for a conversation with Sarah Bishop, VP of Global Brand & Consumer Marketing at the NFL, as she shares how the league is expanding its reach through global growth, cultural relevance, & next-gen brand strategy. The NFL is reaching more fans in more places than ever before. In this session, Sarah Bishop breaks down how her team is driving growth through global expansion, inclusive brand strategy, & culturally attuned marketing. With nearly two decades of experience across sports, media, & tech, Sarah offers a behind-the-scenes look at what it takes to evolve one of the world's most iconic brands - meeting new audiences where they are & building deeper fan affinity across generations. The NFL is evolving what it means to be a fan. In this session, Sarah Bishop shares how her team is expanding the league's global reach - blending strategic partnerships, inclusive storytelling, & culturally attuned campaigns to grow affinity with the next generation of fans. 01Strategic Partnerships as Growth Engines Learn how the NFL is leveraging bold, creative partnerships to connect with audiences beyond traditional sports fans, unlocking new cultural moments, content formats, & commercial opportunities. 02Expanding the Global Footprint From games in Europe to content in local languages, discover how the league is thoughtfully growing its international presence with an eye on both fandom & business impact. 03Marketing for Cultural Relevance Explore how the NFL is building authentic connections with broad audiences, blending tradition with modernity to evolve what the shield represents.

In this session, Sarah Bishop shares how her team is expanding the league's global reach - blending strategic partnerships, inclusive storytelling, & culturally attuned campaigns to grow affinity with the next generation of fans. 01Strategic Partnerships as Growth Engines Learn how the NFL is leveraging bold, creative partnerships to connect with audiences beyond traditional sports fans, unlocking new cultural moments, content formats, & commercial opportunities. 02Expanding the Global Footprint From games in Europe to content in local languages, discover how the league is thoughtfully growing its international presence with an eye on both fandom & business impact. 03Marketing for Cultural Relevance Explore how the NFL is building authentic connections with broad audiences, blending tradition with modernity to evolve what the shield represents.

events.name: Creative Mornings
events.description: Welcome Liza Donnelly to The Morgan Library & Museum Stage! Liza Donnelly is a writer & cartoonist for The New Yorker Magazine, where she has been drawing cartoons & writing about culture & politics for forty years. She has been a contributor to CBS News & CNN, creating political cartoons & animation, as well as live-drawing special cultural & political events. Donnelly writes & draws for The New York Times & CNN Opinion pages, The Washington Post, Medium. She publishes a daily newsletter of writing & drawings called Seeing Things on Substack. Donnelly's TED talk was translated into 42 languages & viewed over 1.5 million times. Donnelly was the first cartoonist to be granted access on location to live draw the Academy Awards. Both on location & remotely, she covered the DNC, Inauguration, presidential debates, State of The Union, Trump trials, election returns, the Emmys, the Golden Globes, the Grammys, the BET Awards, the Tonys. Donnelly is the author/editor of eighteen books for adults & children, most notably Very Funny Ladies, a history of women cartoonists of The New Yorker. Donnelly is currently producing & directing a documentary called Women Laughing, based on her book Very Funny Ladies, to premier in 2025. Performance by Gabbie McGee With two independent albums (Certified Soul, Mississippis Daughter) under her belt, BMI Independent Songwriters Recognition for her song Mississippis Daughter, The 2014 Belk Modern Southern Music Award, the 2014 Mississippi Arts Council Artist of the Year Award, & featured appearances in the 2015 Emmy Award-winning HBO feature film Bessie & the 2016 Academy Award-nominated Hidden Figures, Gabbie McGee is rapidly becoming a recognizable face & name in the entertainment industry. Known for her powerful vocals & heart-gripping lyrics, Gabbie has also made her mark behind the scenes as a music composer, contributing original music to Season 6 of TV ONEs Rickey Smiley For Real & writing, producing, & performing the theme song Turn on the Lights for the 2020 remake of Avenging Angels, directed by Ilunga Adell. In 2025, Gabbie is piloting her latest venture, Jazz Lives in the Library, an innovative cultural preservation & education initiative designed to celebrate the legacy of jazz through live performance, literacy, & community engagement.

events.name: The Crypto Castle
events.description: A true story. In 2015, 22-year-old Viv moves to San Francisco, California. Amidst the housing chaos, she ends up moving into The Crypto Castle: a house with 14 crypto bros & 1 bathroom. She is quickly thrown into their world where bitcoin is the future, death is a fixable glitch, & AI girlfriends are inevitable. As their freaky beliefs gain momentum, she must decide what's real in tech, love, & society-and which side of the future she's on. One4Review calls The Crypto Castle a vivid snapshot of a revolutionary moment in history, brought to life by one of today's most insightful voices. Gig Gossip praises the show, noting, Ford's charisma & razor-sharp wit are undeniable. After an international tour through Hong Kong, Thailand, Vietnam, the UK, & Canada, The Crypto Castle returns to New York for one night!

DETAILS



A true story. In 2015, 22-year-old Viv moves to San Francisco, California. Amidst the housing chaos, she ends up moving into The Crypto Castle: a house with 14 crypto bros & 1 bathroom. She is quickly thrown into their world where bitcoin is the future, death is a fixable glitch, & AI girlfriends are inevitable. As their freaky beliefs gain momentum, she must decide what's real in tech, love, & society-and which side of the future she's on. One4Review calls The Crypto Castle a vivid snapshot of a revolutionary moment in history, brought to life by one of today's most insightful voices. Gig Gossip praises the show, noting, Ford's charisma & razor-sharp wit are undeniable. After an international tour through Hong Kong, Thailand, Vietnam, the UK, & Canada, The Crypto Castle returns to New York for one night!

500 million people died, but we turned "Smallpox is" into "Smallpox was". This is one of our species' greatest victories over suffering; it's a good time to celebrate and to remember.
.

events.name: Derek Parfit's Birthday!
events.description:
Derek Parfit was perhaps the greatest moral philosopher of the 20th century, in how he shaped the discipline and raised important new questions. 

He gave us the Repugnant Conclusion and the Hitchhiker's Dilemma, and put a plug for giving 10% into On What Matters, his masterpiece. Had he lived long enough to finish another volume, he had plans to discuss existential risk and dive deeper into questions of how we ought to act.

How to celebrate Parfit's life and work? You could discuss population ethics, philosophize about something else, or consider, as a group, ways to make your lives slightly more rational. (Or just eat cake and sing Happy Birthday and engage in idle, friendly conversation; Parfit surely wouldn't object.)

events.name: John Snow's Birthday!

events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-soldering-workshop-make-an-led-tile-tickets-1369929639429

Soldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole solderSoldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole soldering workshop. Soldering enables you to create sturdy connections between electrical components. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to use a soldering iron safely and effectively, and get plenty of practice with both soldering and de-soldering techniques. We'll be soldering up some Game of Life kits - LED tiles that generate nifty animations. No previous experience is required, making this introductory workshop a great choice for anyone who's curious about getting started with hardware tinkering! All materials will be provided.
OK, awesome, I want to join!
Please be ready to start at 1pm! We find that you will need this time to get through the whole class. Our classes tend to sell out about a week in advance so if you're interested, you may want to sign up early.
This class will be taught by Resistor member Raphael.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.

We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.

events.name: Synthesizer Night @ NYC Resistor
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/synthesizer-night-nyc-resistor-tickets-1374984639069

Gathering musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. BYO synth encouraged!Join us at NYC Resistor, a makerspace in Brooklyn for an electrifying Synthesizer Night! Get ready to unleash your creativity, explore sonic landscapes, and connect with fellow synth enthusiasts in an evening dedicated to the mesmerizing world of synthesizers. This is a pay-what-you-wish event (recommended donation $8).
Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is a celebration of all things synthesizer. Whether you're a seasoned musician, an avid collector, or simply fascinated by the possibilities of electronic sound, this event offers a unique opportunity to gather with like-minded individuals and revel in the captivating soundscape of synthesizers.
At Synthesizer Night, participants are encouraged to bring their own synthesizers, from vintage analog gems to cutting-edge modular wonders. It's a chance to showcase your personal setup, experiment with new equipment, and dive into the rich sonic tapestry that synthesizers offer.
For those looking to enhance the collaborative experience, consider arriving early to connect your synthesizer to a MIDI/CV clock. This allows for synchronized timing among all instruments, creating a seamless musical fusion during impromptu jam sessions.
In addition to the collaborative jam sessions, the event provides a unique opportunity for a show and tell/play with anything that attendees bring. Share your favorite gear, experiment with different setups, and engage in hands-on exploration of various synthesizers and electronic music equipment.
The event unfolds in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, providing a platform for musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. Whether you're a beginner seeking guidance or an expert eager to inspire others, Synthesizer Night is the perfect setting to engage in conversations, exchange knowledge, and foster a vibrant community. 
Throughout the evening, you'll have the opportunity to engage in impromptu jam sessions, where the collective energy of multiple synthesizers intertwines to create awe-inspiring sounds. Experience the joy of collaborating with fellow musicians, experiment with different genres and styles, and let the unique characteristics of each instrument shape your sonic explorations.
Additionally, for those who wish to showcase their skills and perform, there will be dedicated performance slots. Take center stage, captivate the audience, and let your creativity soar as you demonstrate the full potential of your synthesizer setup. To sign up for a performance slot, email classes@nycresistor.com or join our Discord and post to #synth.
Whether you're an ardent synth enthusiast, an aspiring musician, or simply curious about the captivating world of synthesizers, Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is an event that will inspire, educate, and leave you in awe of the boundless possibilities that electronic sound offers. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in an evening of music, collaboration, and innovation. Mark your calendars, pack up your favorite synths, and join us at NYC Resistor for a night you won't soon forget. We can't wait to see you there!
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: diyaudio.nyc JuneMeetup
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/diyaudionyc-junemeetup-tickets-1408840352419

Resistor hosts a meetup for the diyaudio.nyc group, and invites anyone to come learn about making your own home audio gear.diyaudio.nyc has regular meetups to share recent DIY projects (speakers, amps, preamps, tubes and solid state - anything home-audio related), as well as talks and demos on related topics and skills (how to solder, how digital crossovers work, fabrication techniques, digital room correction, etc). Building your own gear doesn't have to be a solitary hobby anymore... has regular meetups to share recent DIY audio projects (speakers, amps, DACs, etc - anything home-audio related), as well as talks and demos on related topics and skills (how to solder, how digital crossovers work, fabrication techniques, digital room correction, etc).
This month we're going to show off some new and exciting speaker and amp projects, a demo on how to refurbish a classic iPod(!), and we'll also have a tutorial on how to simulate bass-reflex enclosures in WinISD - a key skill for anyone looking to design their own speakers.It always sounds better when you build it yourself.
Have a project you'd like to share? Let us know at diyaudio@gowanusaudio.com and we'll add it to the list.
(If history is any guide, at the end of the meetup some of us will want to keep talking about projects and we'll move to a bar nearby - join us!)
Who should come?
Open to anyone interested in DIY home audio who wants to learn and make some new friends - all experience levels welcome. If you've ever wanted to build any audio gear, we're here for you. (We generally don't focus on production, live sound, musical instruments, or making music, although there certainly is some overlap.)
Note from the organizer, Pete:
I started diyaudio.nyc a couple years ago because I wanted to meet some like-minded folks near me - I knew they were out there. And they are! Thank you for being a part! Let's grow this group! These days, for me, it's all audio all the time - I work as a Buyer for The Music Room buying high end audio equipment, and also offer complete classes to build your own equipment as Gowanus Audio.
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com

events.name: Learn to Use a Laser Cutter to Cut and Etch Your Own Designs
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-use-a-laser-cutter-to-cut-and-etch-your-own-designs-tickets-1422390671789

Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need.Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need to know to make the ideas in your head become a reality with a laser.
In this three hour class, you will learn:
How to set up a file for cutting on the laser cutter in Inkscape or Adobe Illustrator.Laser cutter safety including materials testing.Laser cutter operation including configuration, cuts and raster etching in common materials like wood, acrylic, cardboard and others.At the end of class, you will go home with:
One laser cut project, either the class default or a simple one of your own design (see below for details)Resistor Laser Certification, enabling you to use our laser on Craft Nights.Please bring the following to class:
A laptop with either Inkscape (free: download here: https://inkscape.org/release/inkscape-1.2.1/) or Adobe Illustrator installed.
A USB jump drive
The following items are optional if you'd like to try cutting a simple custom design. If your file ends up being too complicated, we may have you do the class default project first, just to learn the laser in the time allotted - but we'll definitely help you with your more complex cut at a free Craft Night in future!
An SVG vector file of a simple shape you'd like to cut for your first cut.A piece of 1/8 inch or thinner wood, acrylic or cardboard you'd like to cut. If you can't bring your own material, small pieces will be made available, or larger pieces for purchase on site.Please be on time for the start of class! If you're late you will miss your slot.
This class will be taught by NYC Resistor member Katie. As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Eco-Resin Fabric Casting Class
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/eco-resin-fabric-casting-class-tickets-1407554997889

Make various accessories by upcycling fabric scraps and using them as the decorative colorant within eco-resin! All materials provided.Lizzy Gee, a sustainable fashion designer, leads a lesson in how to make various accessories by upcycling fabric scraps and using them as the decorative colorant within eco-resin! They’ve been experimenting and honing this innovative craft, that uses a material that is NOT plastic to mold into any shape you can imagine. They use the genius method of embedding the smallest scraps from their collections, so that nothing goes to waste.This workshop is perfect for those who want learn to do resin-pours, textile artists who want to make brilliant use of your smallest scraps, and anyone who wants to spend a few hours making your own beautiful jewelry, beads, pendants, keychains, or experiment with a new sustainable method! Choose between a pair of earrings, necklace, buttons and/or keychain!All materials are supplied! Eco-Resin, molds, and a dehydrator for a faster drying process! Bring your own beloved too-good-to-toss scraps, or use Lizzy Gee’s gorgeous textile tidbits! Also, while we wait for your creations to dry, feel free to bring your own mending/sewing/textile projects and get advice from a seasoned sustainable designer about next steps. Lizzy is open to all levels of maker and hopes to see you there!
No experience required! You just need to be interested in sustainability and/or textiles. Everyone is welcome.Your Instructor:
Lizzy has always found it natural to express her ideas with a visual language. Lizzy saw the design process as a self-empowering tool to make her ideas transcend to reality and foster a genuine inclusivity.  By age 11, she was creating entire collections from inspiration to runway.  A native of Philadelphia, Lizzy moved to Brooklyn, New York to pursue her dream of creating a sustainable, inclusive fashion brand.  She attended Pratt Institute after earning a scholarship in their Fashion Design program.  After graduating with honors in 2018, she continued to develop her brand and has showcased her collections in Fashion Weeks in New York, London, and Philadelphia.  Not only did she launch her business within the first of year of graduating, but also founded a sustainable New York Fashion Week initiative called IMPACT NYFW.  Practicing sustainable design with her brand, she wanted to further transcend eco-conscious methods in regards to how designs were presented by acting on another passion- event production. IMPACT is an annual, alternative New York fashion week platform for emerging, sustainable designers to showcase their work while making an impact beyond the runway by donating ticket proceeds to an environmental non-profit. Along with IMPACT, her award-winning designs have been showcased in galleries at Moore College of Art and Design, University of the Arts Philadelphia, Pratt Institute, and Screaming Mimi's NYC front window display.  While studying fashion at Pratt, Lizzy apprenticed for many successful designers, including Christian Siriano, Badgley Mischka, Mara Hoffman, and Nicola Formichetti. Not only have her colorful designs been worn by music artists, such as, Grimes and Kimbra, but they’ve also been highlighted in publications including British Vogue and Schon! magazine. Lizzy is continuing to build her sustainable brand with the mission of giving the world innovative perspectives of beauty and functional design by breaking the boundaries of social constructs limiting our potential as individuals.This is a masks optional workshop.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: NYCResistor Ham Radio Club
events.description:
Vaccination Proof + Mask + RSVP Required
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096564789

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Intro to Soldering Workshop: Make an LED Tile
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-soldering-workshop-make-an-led-tile-tickets-1422385536429

Soldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole solderSoldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole soldering workshop. Soldering enables you to create sturdy connections between electrical components. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to use a soldering iron safely and effectively, and get plenty of practice with both soldering and de-soldering techniques. We'll be soldering up some Game of Life kits - LED tiles that generate nifty animations. No previous experience is required, making this introductory workshop a great choice for anyone who's curious about getting started with hardware tinkering! All materials will be provided.
OK, awesome, I want to join!
Please be ready to start at 1pm! We find that you will need this time to get through the whole class. Our classes tend to sell out about a week in advance so if you're interested, you may want to sign up early.
This class will be taught by Resistor member Jack Poon.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.
